errors.generic: Something went wrong, please reload the page
errors.linkExpired: The link is either incorrect or expired

array.lessThan: Must be less than {than, plural, one {# item} other {# items}}
array.moreThan: Must be more than {than, plural, one {# item} other {# items}}

string.username: You can use only letters, numbers, dot, underscode and dash
string.email: Must be a valid email address
string.minLength: Must be more than {than, plural, one {# symbol} other {# symbols}}
string.maxLength: Must be less than {than, plural, one {# symbol} other {# symbols}}

onboarding.main: We use your master-password to encrypt your data. {boldO}It cannot be restored{boldC}, so do remember it!

help.common: 6 chars minimum, but we recommend using longer and varied passwords.
help.invite: All unaccapted wallet invites will become obsolete once you change your master-password.

pin.help: Pin code is a 6-digit password, that you can enter each time you open the app instead of the master-password. It is only stored on the device, so it does not mitigate the security of your data.
pin.label: Pin-code

onboarding.main: Pin-code allows you to sign in by using a simple 6-digit password instead of master-password. Very handy on mobile devices.
onboarding.device: Pin-code never leaves the device, so you'd need to set it on other devices as well.

form.defCategories: Create a set of default categories
form.jointWalletsWarning: You can create joint wallets once you have 2 or more wallets with the same currency. Joint wallet will allow you to analyze data from all the wallets at once.
form.singleCurrencyError: Wallets should have the same currency

delete.walletName: You're about to delete the wallet {tagO}{walletName}{tagC}.
delete.cannotRestore: Bear in mind all the data will be wiped immediately. {tagO}It cannot be restored{tagC}.
delete.verification: Please enter wallet's name here to verify your decision.

userAccess.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure? The user will lose their access to the wallet completely.

invite.oneTime: The link is a one-time use.
invite.sendIt: Send it to the person you want to join the wallet. They will be able to read, create, update and delete stuff in this wallet.
invite.beOnline: You will need to be online when the user will start the joining process to make a safe encryption key exchange.
invite.keySecurity: This operation is secured by an encryption key. Here's its emoji representation:

owner.title: Permission to join a wallet
owner.userData: User {tagO}{username}{tagC} wants to join your wallet {tagO}{walletName}{tagC}.

ask.expl: The wallet owner should be online for you to join the wallet. Make sure they are and launch the process!

error.main: Cannot tell you any details. Please try later.
error.title: Some error occured

notWallet.main: This is not a wallet invite, so you cannot redeem it.
notWallet.title: No can do

reject.title: The wallet owner refused to add you
reject.expl: Settle your stuff somewhere and come with a new invite later, because this one is invalid now.

onboarding.main: We do not use accounts in out app. The main entity is a wallet. Wallet unites all the accounts, assets and debts that correspond to a single idea: family, business, individual.

importFile.title: Find a file
importFile.main: Upload a statement from your bank. We accept {tagO}.csv{tagC} files.

importButton.itsEasy: It works best when you create transactions by uploading bank statements. Works fast, doesn't make any errors, and makes most of the work automatically after a while.
importButton.decision: Press the "{tagO}{buttonText}{tagC}" button now or try later.

category.zeroData: No categories has been created yet

delete.title: Delete category
delete.categoryAssignedTo: This category is assigned to {count, plural, one {# transaction} other {# transactions}}. You can replace it with another category.

common.count: {count, plural, =0 {No transactions} one {# transaction} other {# transactions}}

reference.unsetBalance: Balance is not set just yet. You need to calculate what your net worth is now or at any point in time.
reference.seeDynamics: Balance lets you see your net worth in dynamic, whether it goes up or down.

transaction.zeroData: There's no transactions during that period

deleteEntity.irreversible: This process is irreversible, you won't be able to restore data after deletion!

dashboard.zeroData: No transactions were created yet. Go ahead and do that!

categoryChart.zeroData: Here will be a chart of transactions by category

404.title: Whoah!
404.main: You've come to a place you shouldn't be! Try another link.

bug.title: Found a bug?
bug.main: We'd really appreciate if you reported it here. Help us become better!

help.title: Don't understand something?
help.main: Don't hesitate to drop a message here. We'll help.

featureReq.title: Enhancement proposal
featureReq.main: We value all your ideas. Please share all of them with us here.

email.notSet: You haven't set any email yet.
email.setNew: Enter your new email address. We have this email saved: {email}.
email.toVerifyNotif: You'll get a verification email. Press the only huge button there and that'll be it.
email.verifyFail: Email is not verified. The link is either incorrect or expired.

invites.send: Send this link to the person you want to invite. They can use it to sign up!
invites.help: This link can be used multiple times, but it changes every time you visit this page. Don't panic, old links will still work.

signup.whyEmail: We need email so you can restore access to the account in case you forget the password. it is unnecessary though. In future we'll ask you if you want to get promo-emails.
signup.agree: By creating an account you agree with the {tagO}terms and conditions{tagC}.

restore.title: Restore password
restore.notification: We've sent an email. Follow the instructions there.
restore.emailHelp: If you added an email address to your account, then you'll get an email with instructions on how to restore password.

logs.label: Logs for debugging
logs.help: Log data is saved upon many different actions. It is always wiped after you close the tab/app. It never has any personal data or data you expect to be encrypted.

cache.prevFile: You haven't finished importing a file {tagO}{filename}{tagC} on {date, date, short}.
cache.decision: Do you wish to continue your work or drop it and upload a new file?

errors.andNErrors: and {count, plural, one {# error} other {# errors}} more.

date.label: Date format
date.formatInfo: Specify the format of the date. {tagO}dd{tagC} — day of month; {tagO}MM{tagC} — month; {tagO}yyyy{tagC} — year; {tagO}HH{tagC} — hour; {tagO}mm{tagC} — minutes; {tagO}ss{tagC} — seconds.
date.formatExample: For example, {tagO}2020-12-24{tagC} would have {tagO}yyyy-MM-dd{tagC} as format.
date.docs: For more options to specify date parts please {tagO}go here{tagC}.

automation.successNotif: Settings will be used when you start a new import

power.label: Power
power.help: Defines how often we will try to automatically resolve transactions based on your previous data. The higher it is the higher are the chances of errors in category or user assignment.

bankStatement.link: {linkO}Visit out forum{linkC} and ask for help. Most of the time we {tagO}only need 24 hours{tagC} to handle the problem.
bankStatement.main: If the uploaded file is a bank statement then we'd be glad to add support for it! You and other clients of this bank will be able to upload their statements and get the transactions automatically.

finish.main: Once you've marked all the columns with useful data, save the scheme and start sorting out the transactions.

isBank.main1: We can (and very much want) to support bank statements from all over the world.
isBank.main2: If you downloaded a bank statement, then contact us. We'll support it in 24 hours.
isBank.title: Is it a bank statement?

unknown.title: Couldn't parse automatically
unknown.main: We couldn't parse this file automatically. But don't worry, there're some solutions to this.

settings.title: Here are the settings
settings.main: If you see gibberish in the table below, your table doesn't have a header row or the numbers are not correct, then you should go here.

main.title: Match the columns with the data
main.main2: The data will be parsed immediately. If there will be no errors, you'll see {emoji}.
main.main1: Choose what data the column has in the dropdown list.

notBank.main: In this case you only need to set the so-called {tagO}data scheme{tagC}.
notBank.title: What if it's not from a bank?

troubleshoot.title: Troubleshoot
troubleshoot.question: Is something incorrect?
troubleshoot.resetIfSure: If you know for sure what you're doing, try resetting the scheme.

tabs.save: {tagO}{tab}{tagC} is what will be saved as a regular transaction, income or expense.
tabs.queue: {tagO}{tab}{tagC} is all the records that needs to be resolved.
tabs.ignore: {tagO}{tab}{tagC} are transactions that shouldn't be shown in future. E.g. transfers between your accounts.
tabs.draft: {tagO}{tab}{tagC} are unclear transactions. E.g. if it was made by your partner and you don't know what category it should belong. It will be saved into a separate section, but won't affect the balance.

onboarding.saveTransactions: When you made your decision about this transaction, press one of these buttons. You can also use keyboard shortcuts on desktops.

parsed.main: Click on the card if we had a wrong guess with the category or you just want to make changes.

final.savePlace: Don't be afraid to accidentally close the tab or save a small part of work — we'll offer you to pick up where you left off!
final.clickWhenSave: Click this button when you just want to save what you've already resolved.

automation.main: The import is smart. It'll catch all the duplicate transactions, try to guess the category and even automatically resolve most of the transactions after a while.
automation.header: Automation. A hell of a lot of it.

file.drag: or drag it into the window
file.notCsv: The chosen file is not a CSV file. Please choose another one.
file.noParsedData: File has no data to parse

walletUsers.title: Whose transactions is can be
walletUsers.help: Here's a list of people to whom transactions can be linked — who can spend or earn.

walletAccess.title: Wallet access
walletAccess.help: Here's a list of people who has access to this wallet's data.
